intro: Nasturtium racemosum, commonly known as the climbing nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible seeds that are often used in salads. Its stems are trailing or climbing, allowing it to grow along supports or other plants. Nasturtium racemosum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators and its use in traditional medicine.
